chapter.title: Errata
chapter.para: The following statements in version #.#.# of the Base Document Title specification are incorrect, and should be considered corrected as specified.

section.para:
Problem:
TBD: Describe the problem here. For example, "Paragraph 2 contains a statement that makes use of undefined behavior according to the C standard." Then, cite the offending text in the next paragraph block.

para.phrase: Regardless of the alignment rules for the allocation of data types, pointers to both aligned and unaligned data of each data type shall return the value corresponding to a data type starting at the specified address when accessed with either the pointer dereference operator * or the array reference operator [ ].

section.para: Resolution: TBD: Describe resolution. For example, "Paragraph 2 is stricken from the text." If needed, add a block quote of the updated text like below.

para.phrase: C pointer types have an emperical and undefined behavior which applications should simply tolerate. Therefore and regardless of the alignment rules for the allocation of data types, pointers to both aligned and unaligned data of each data type shall return the value corresponding to a data type starting at the specified address when accessed with either the pointer dereference operator * or the array reference operator [ ]. Anything that doesn't work is somebody else's problem.
